title: The Reasons Why We Cant Have Solo Q
body:
1.every season riot tries its best to make some changes to reach a PEAK  of active games  for their annual statistics,this season's peak was in the begining of the season.
2.the next change was halfing the exp to reach lvl 30 so that they increase the active PLAYERBASE.
solo queue can not be released this season because it has nothing to offer to riot games,it will probably be released next year for their annual active games peak and active playerbase peak.

replies.body: Or cause people wanna play with friends.
you can play with friends,people who want solo queue dont want to get rid of dynamic queue they just want a solo queue added in the game.

i dont see why so many people like you dont want solo queue to exist,are you afraid you will not be able to climb in a more competitive environment?why are you against a new queue in the game? i have never played twisted treeline or dominion but i never suggested them being removed,or ranted someone who wants them back because i just dont like them.
Having 2 ranked queues would dramatically increase the queue time for both, which was something Riot was trying to reduce with Dynamic Queue.

if only a "vocal minority" wants solo queue like our riot emploee #lyte says then dynamic queue will not face any issue,
solo queue survived season 2.

The thing is, those who don't care a lot about whether they are in Dynamic Queue or Solo Queue will still switch over to Solo Queue as it will be slightly better for them (probably).  Even though their preference is negligible, they will naturally pick whichever queue gives them the most control over their games.

league of legends as a game is a team game in a sense that you have a team but not in a sense that most people play as premades,the biggest portion of the community is solo players,if you ask me whether i would accept not having a solo queue but having split ladders (like the way it is in dota) i would be skeptical about it but it would surely be better than the way it is now.split ladders mean playing in the same queue but having a solo rank and a team rank.
I'd be fine with that for the most part, though I'd be worried about it possibly matching you up with people of a very different skill level when you play the way you least often play.
